properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 10 at 8:30PM EST until February 12 at 9:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis has issued a Flood
Warning for portions of the following waterways in central and
southern Indiana...

Mill Creek...White River...

.Lowland flooding is expected to develop along the White River and
Mill Creek as a result of about 2 inches of rain that fell across the
area in the past 48 hours. Significant flooding is not expected.

The National Weather Service in Indianapolis has issued a

* Flood Warning for
the White River near Nora.
* from Tuesday morning to Wednesday morning.
* At  8:00 PM Monday the stage was 9.8 feet.
* Flood stage is 11.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by Tuesday morning and continue
to rise to near 11.6 feet by Tuesday afternoon.  It will fall below
flood stage by Tuesday evening.
* At 11.0 feet...Local roads begin to flood.  Howland Ditch begins to
flood 69th Street west of Kingsley Drive.  Water is at the edge of
River Edge Lane and the section of River Road located north of 86th
Street and south of I-465.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
